Bearer.name: Authorization
Bearer.description: The authorization request header should use the Bearer authorization scheme followed by the access token. Example: 'Bearer c2ebc483a02985ca9ae6f5f17ef3f454'

info.title: ACH Payments
info.description: The Automated Clearing House (ACH) Payments API v2 allows you to initiate an ACH credit transaction to a creditor or beneficiary, initiate an ACH debit transaction to collect from a debtor or payer, and check an ACH credit or debit transaction status using a payment identification. ACH Payments API v2 validates your ACH credit or debit requests and sends accepted requests to Wells Fargo’s ACH processing application or ACH processor for transaction execution.

post.description: Pay a creditor or beneficiary using ACH credit.

client-request-id.description: A value you generate to track each API call. A UUID value compliant with RFC 4122 is required. Echoed back in the response header.

gateway-request-id.description: A unique value generated by Wells Fargo Gateway to track the API request. It will be returned in the header of the response.

content-type.description: Describes the data in the body of your request.

authorization_HEADER.name: authorization
authorization_HEADER.description:
Access token
“Bearer” is the token type.

client-request-id_HEADER.name: client-request-id
client-request-id_HEADER.description: Your request identification in universally unique identifier version 4 (UUID v4) and variant RFC4122 format

gateway-entity-id_HEADER.name: gateway-entity-id
gateway-entity-id_HEADER.description:
Wells Fargo Gateway entity identification

Wells Fargo generates your Gateway entity identification during your onboarding to our API services.

gateway-request-id_HEADER.name: gateway-request-id
gateway-request-id_HEADER.description: Wells Fargo Gateway’s identification, in universally unique identifier version 4 (UUID v4) and variant RFC4122 format, for your request

ceo-company-id_HEADER.name: ceo-company-id
ceo-company-id_HEADER.description:
Wells Fargo CEO company identification

If you’re a Wells Fargo client, it’s optional for you to provide your CEO company identification. If you’re a third-party service provider, initiating request for a Wells Fargo client, provide the CEO company identification of the Wells Fargo client.

Authorization_HEADER.name: Authorization
Authorization_HEADER.description:
Access token

“Bearer” is the token type.

idempotency-key_HEADER.name: idempotency-key
idempotency-key_HEADER.description:
Your idempotency identification in universally unique identifier version 4 (UUID v4) and variant RFC4122 format

Provide a unique value for each Credit or Debit request allowing us to identify PROCESSED/ACCEPTED transactions within a 24-hour time frame. If an Idempotent transaction is identified, ACH v2 responds with the same payment_id each time so you may safely retry transactions.

sec_code.description: Your transaction’s standard entry class (SEC) code

duplicate_check.description: Customize your duplicate check experience by providing a specific value. If no value is provided, Wells Fargo will automatically check for duplicates by default against your ACH v2 transactions from the past 124 days.

entry_description.description:
Transaction description 


Transaction receiver sees the entry_description on the account posting or bank statement. Typically, you provide the transaction purpose here, example, “Payroll”, “Premium”, etc.

requested_execution_date.description:
Value date


Wells Fargo’s payment application starts processing the transaction on the value date. You can provide a value date 60   days  in future from your transaction initiation date. Wells Fargo maps requested_execution_date
to Nacha file “Effective Entry Date” field.

debtor_DEF.description: Debtor’s information. A debtor is a Wells Fargo client, paying a creditor using ACH credit, from a Wells Fargo account.

ach_company_id.description:
Debtor’s Wells Fargo ACH Company identification

Depending on your business organization, Wells Fargo creates one or many ACH company identifications for you. Wells Fargo associates each ACH company identification to one of your Wells Fargo accounts. For a successful ACH credit, Wells Fargo debits your account associated with the ach_company_id you provide.

end_to_end_id.description:
Debtor’s reference for the transaction

If you’re a third-party service provider, initiating request for a Wells Fargo client, it could be your transaction reference as well.
Wells Fargo maps end_to_end_id to Nacha file individual ID positions; ACH origination report “recipient ID” field ; ACH webhook recipient_id parameter.

amount.description:
Transaction amount in N.NN format   
For an amount less than 1, a leading 0 (e.g., 0.25) before the decimal is required. Decimals (e.g., .0 or .00) for a whole number are optional.

currency.description: Transaction currency code in ISO 4217 alphabetic format

creditor2_DEF.description: Creditor’s information. A creditor is an entity a Wells Fargo client is paying, using ACH credit, from a Wells Fargo account.

currency.description: Creditor’s account currency in ISO 4217 alphabetic format

country_code.description: Creditor’s account country code in ISO 3166 format

unstructured_addenda.description:
Information

Nacha operating rules, for sec_code “CCD” or “PPD”, allow one addenda per  transaction. If you want to send an addenda, provide one string within the array. Each string in the array has a maximum length of 80.

payment_id.description: Wells Fargo’s reference for the transaction

status_as_of.description: Transaction status date time in YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS.mmmZ format (GMT)

field_name.description: The field name where the error occurred.

field_value.description: The value submitted in the request.

api_specification_url.description: A link to the API specification.

sec_code.description: Your transaction’s standard entry class (SEC) code

duplicate_check.description: Customize your duplicate check experience by providing a specific value. If no value is provided, Wells Fargo will automatically check for duplicates by default against your ACH v2 transactions from the past 124 days.

entry_description.description:
Transaction description 
 
Transaction receiver sees the entry_description on the account posting or bank statement. Typically, you provide the transaction purpose here, example, “Payroll”, “Premium”, etc.

ach_company_id.description:
Creditor’s Wells Fargo ACH Company identification

Depending on your business organization, Wells Fargo creates one or many ACH company identifications for you. Wells Fargo associates each ACH company identification to one of your Wells Fargo accounts. For a successful ACH credit, Wells Fargo debits your account associated with the ach_company_id you provide.

end_to_end_id.description:
Creditor’s reference for the transaction

If you’re a third-party service provider, initiating request for a Wells Fargo client, it could be your transaction reference as well.
Wells Fargo maps end_to_end_id to Nacha file individual ID positions; ACH origination report “recipient ID” field; ACH webhook recipient_id parameter.

debtor2_DEF.description: Represents the entity sending money as a result of the transaction. For a direct debit transaction, the entity your company is debiting is the debtor.

currency.description: Debtor’s account currency in ISO 4217 alphabetic format

country_code.description: Debtor’s account country code in ISO 3166 format

payment_id.description: Wells Fargo’s reference for the transaction

status_as_of.description: Transaction status date time in YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS.mmmZ format (GMT)

payment_id.description: Wells Fargo’s reference for the transaction

status_datetime.description: Transaction status date time in YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS.mmmZ format (GMT)

ach_file_id.description:
Your Wells Fargo ACH file identification

Your ACH file identification identifies you as the ACH transaction originator. Wells Fargo populates the ACH file ID in the Nacha file company/batch control record.

sec_code.description: Your transaction’s standard entry class (SEC) code

discretionary_data.description: Recurring, single or standing authorization indicator

amount.description: Amount of the payment being made.

currency.description: The currency code for the payment, expressed using the ISO 4217 alpha 3 currency code.

ach_company_id.description: Debtor’s Wells Fargo ACH Company identification

currency.description: Debtor’s account currency in ISO 4217 alphabetic format

country_code.description: Debtor’s account country code in ISO 3166 format

ach_company_id.description: Creditor’s Wells Fargo ACH Company identification

currency.description: Creditor’s account currency in ISO 4217 alphabetic format

country_code.description: Creditor’s account country code in ISO 3166 format
